meanings.definition: A narrow opening or crack, typically in a wall or structure.
meanings.sent1: The chinking in the old wall allowed a small mouse to sneak through.
meanings.sent2: The chinking in the fence needed repair to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent3: The chinking in the dam was so wide that even the fish could peek through.
meanings.sent4: The chinking in the armor of the knight was his only vulnerability.
meanings.sent5: The chinking in the boat's hull caused it to slowly take on water.

meanings.definition: The act of filling in gaps or cracks with a material such as mortar or wood.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa spent the afternoon chinking the gaps in the cabin walls with fresh mortar.
meanings.sent2: The chinking of the log cabin was essential to keep the cold wind out.
meanings.sent3: The chinking of the cake layers with cream made it a delicious treat.
meanings.sent4: The chinking of the broken vase with gold glue made it look unique and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The chinking of the broken friendship with kind words healed their bond.

meanings.definition: A sound made by metal or glass objects striking together.
meanings.sent1: The chinking of the coins in his pocket was a comforting sound.
meanings.sent2: The chinking of the glasses clinking together signaled the start of the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The chinking of the wind chimes in the garden created a soothing melody.
meanings.sent4: The chinking of the keys in her handbag reminded her of the tasks ahead.
meanings.sent5: The chinking of the ice cubes in the glass added a refreshing touch to the drink.
